bibl.title: The Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion. (1861-65.)

taxonomy.bibl: Medical and Surgical History of the War of the Rebellion

keywords.term: wounds and injuries of the lower extremities
wounds and injuries of the hip joint
shot fractures at the hip joint
shot fractures at the hip joint unsuccessfully treated by conservation
acetabulum and head of femur fractured
ball entered below and exterior to Poupart's ligament, fracturing head of femur and acetabulum

revisionDesc.change: additional proofing of transcription and encoding, identified keyword terms
case text extracted and transformed from larger file
Sarah Synovec initial checking of OCR text; encoded P5 Encoding

body.p: CASE 159.—Corporal G. W. Stepps, Co. C, 20th North Carolina, aged 20 years, was wounded at Spottsylvania Spotsylvania , May 12, 1864, and entered Lincoln Hospital, Washington, on May 22d. Assistant Surgeon J. C. McKee, U. S. A., reported: "Gunshot wound of right groin, a minié ball entering half an inch below and exterior to the middle of Poupart's ligament, fracturing the head of the femur and the acetabulum, and escaping at the middle of the right nates natis . Death occurred on June 10, 1864." A portion of the os innominatum, represented in the wood-cut (FIG. 32), was contributed by Acting Assistant Surgeon H. M. Dean.—(Cat. Surg. Sect., 1866, p. 236, Spec. 2488.)

figure.head: FIG. 32.—Portion of right innominatum, with fracture of base of the acetabulum. Spec. 2488.
